qas.question: What did the Sumerian deities form?
What could Sumerian gods be associated with?
What did the religious importance of city gods wax and wan with?
Why did the gods create human beings from clay?

answers.text: for the purpose of serving them

qas.question: How could a citizen avoid their labor duty to their local temple?
What did each Sumerian city have?
What changed with a particular gods popularity?
Who made humans for their amusement?

context: These deities formed <a0_0>a core pantheon<a0_0/>; there were additionally hundreds of minor ones. Sumerian <b5_0>gods<b5_0/> could thus have associations with <a1_0>different cities<a1_0/>, and their religious importance often waxed and waned with <a2_0>those <b6_0>cities' political power<a2_0/>.<b6_0/> The <b7_0>gods<b7_0/> were said to have created human beings from clay <a3_0>for the purpose of serving them<a3_0/>. <b8_0>The temples<b8_0/> organized the mass labour projects needed for irrigation agriculture. Citizens had a labor duty to the temple, though they could avoid it by <a4_0>a payment of silver<a4_0/>.
